item.title: bahar add a quote by Andrew Wolfe
item.description: "A book without words is like love without a kiss; it's empty." -- Andrew Wolfe

item.title: bahar add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "Our love of each other was like two long shadows kissing without hope of reality." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: bahar add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: bahar add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: bahar add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: bahar add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: bahar add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "I can remember when the air was clean and sex was dirty." -- George Burns

item.title: bahar add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In heaven, all the interesting people are missing." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: bahar add a quote by حسین پناهی
item.description: "هنوز از اتاق همینگوی بوی باروت میاد هنوز هم ادکلن مرلین مونرو نیمه تمام مانده و پیرزنان به وقت گذشتن از کف آخرین اتاق مایاکوفسکی دامن خود را جمع می کنند یکی می آید به زور یکی می رود به انتخاب" -- حسین پناهی

item.title: bahar add a quote by bahar
item.description: "علی رغم کرشمه ء کاکتوس،هیچکس،هیچگاه، به نوازش تن سبزش نیامد" -- bahar

item.title: bahar add a quote by Mawlana Jalal al-Din Rumi
item.description: "When someone is counting out gold for you, don't look at your hands, or the gold. Look at the giver." -- Mawlana Jalal al-Din Rumi

item.title: bahar add a quote by Omar Khayam
item.description: "ای آمده از عالم روحانی تفت حیران شده در چهار و پنج و شش و هفت می خور چو ندانی ز کجا آمده ای خوش باش ندانی به کجا خواهی رفت" -- Omar Khayam

item.title: bahar add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I act as the tongue of you, ... tied in your mouth . . . . in mine it begins to be loosened." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: bahar add a quote by Yehuda Amichai
item.description: "And I said to myself: That's true, hope needs to be like barbed wire to keep out despair, hope must be a mine field." -- Yehuda Amichai

item.title: bahar add a quote by Frank Capra
item.description: "I made mistakes in drama. I thought drama was when actors cried. But drama is when the audience cries." -- Frank Capra

item.title: bahar add a quote by Thomas De Quincey
item.description: "But my way of writing is rather to think aloud, and follow my own humours, than much to consider who is listening to me; and, if I stop to consider what is proper to be said to this or that person, I shall soon come to doubt whether any part at all is proper." -- Thomas De Quincey

item.title: bahar add a quote by Walter Benjamin
item.description: "What, in the end, makes advertisements superior to criticism? Not what the moving red neon says—but the fiery pool reflecting it in the asphalt." -- Walter Benjamin

item.title: bahar add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: bahar add a quote by Walter Benjamin
item.description: "Every morning brings us news of the globe, and yet we are poor in noteworthy stories. This is because no event comes to us without being already shot through with explanation. In other words, by now almost nothing that happens benefits storytelling; almost everything benefits information. Actually, it is half the art of storytelling to keep a story free from explanation as one reproduces it. . . . The most extraordinary things, marvelous things, are related with the greatest accuracy, but the psychological connection of the event is not forced on the reader. It is left up to him to interpret things the way he understands them, and thus the narrative achieves an amplitude that information lacks." -- Walter Benjamin

item.title: bahar add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "A poet is, before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: bahar add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Don't interrupt me while I'm interrupting." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: bahar add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Someone told me the delightful story of the crusader who put a chastity belt on his wife and gave the key to his best friend for safekeeping, in case of his death. He had ridden only a few miles away when his friend, riding hard, caught up with him, saying 'You gave me the wrong key!" -- Anais Nin

item.title: bahar add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Dad, how do soldiers killing each other solve the world's problems?" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: bahar add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "You only live twice: Once when you're born And once when you look death in the face." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: bahar add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: bahar add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "As to my mouth, of all my features, I wish I could possess my mouth again, just as it had been before the fire. I had my mother’s lips, generous below and above; and what kissing I had practiced, mainly on my hand or on a lonely pig, had convinced me that my lips would be the source of my good fortune. I would kiss with them, and lie with them, I would make victims and willing slaves of anyone my eyes desired, simply by talking a little, and following the talk with kisses, and the kisses with demands. And they’d melt into compliance, everyone of them, happy to perform the most demeaning acts as long as I was there to reward them with a long, tongue-tied kiss when they were done. But the fire didn’t spare my lips; it took them too, erasing them utterly." -- Clive Barker

item.title: bahar add a quote by Jarod Kintz
item.description: "I am the sunrise of sunsets, and I make love like noon at midnight. " -- Jarod Kintz

item.title: bahar add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: bahar add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: bahar add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "People living deeply have no fear of death." -- Anaïs Nin
